pros:
Patient carevis number one. 
ER staff is on their toes at all times to bring you the best kind of care there is. 
The nursing staff is 100% caring and nurturing during your time of need. 
The doctors interact in a way that makes you feel cared for and will answer all of your questions.
cons: Needs a bigger ER to better serve the community. A possible expansion would help better suit the multitude of patients that come from all over to receive care at Saint Mary's.

job_title: Quality Assurance Analyst in Russellville, AR
pros: Plenty of work time due to turn over rate.
cons: Feeling bullied when performing duties of job

pros: Flexibility Commute Family Environment Don’t just feel like a number
cons: Salary Benefits Support Technology is dated

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Reno, NV
pros: Insurance paid for, pto, sick time, food program
cons: Literally how the department is structured. The management is absent minded and clueless. The actual job duties themselves are redundant because no one is in charge. The blind leading the blind is a recipe for failure. If any new hire can last 2 months I would be surprised. Not a place where you will be valued or acknowledged. They are short staffed because of terrible management. Good luck!

pros: Don't have nothing great to say
cons: They don't care about their patients. The workers are horrible.

review_title: Pay is poor, support is minimal and appreciation is nonexistent
cons: Company is very “for the top”. Administration is only concerned about making money and not about its employees or improvements to patient care. Hands down, worst company I’ve worked for.
